prefs-continuum-enable-continuum-1-label: Label for the checkbox to force Legacy Continuum operation accessible via Special:Preferences. When this checkbox is enabled, the December 19 of Continuum is used. When this checkbox is disabled, the actively developed version of Continuum is used instead.
prefs-continuum-enable-continuum-1-help: Detail explaining the operation of the prefs-continuum-enable-continuum-1-label checkbox.
continuum-opt-out: Text of link that takes the user to the Special:Preferences page so they can opt-out of the latest version of Continuum and go back to legacy Continuum.
continuum-opt-out-tooltip: Used as the tooltip for the Continuum opt-out link
continuum-action-toggle-sidebar: Accessibility label for the button that toggles the sidebar's visibility, as well as audible presentation for screen readers.
continuum-languages:
Label for language alert in sidebar when language switching is in header

{{Identical|Language}}
continuum-language-button-aria-label:
Accessibility label for language button dropdown menu in modern Continuum.
* $1 - the count of languages available, supports plural
continuum-language-button-label:
Label for language button in modern Continuum.

Arguments:
* $1 number of languages, supports plural
continuum-no-language-button-label: Label for language button when article does not exist in any other language.
continuum-no-language-button-aria-label: Accessibility label for language button dropdown menu in modern Continuum.
continuum-language-variant-switcher-labe: Label for the language variant switcher.
continuum-action-addsection:
Used in the Continuum skin. See for example {{canonicalurl:Talk:Main_Page|useskin=continuum}}
{{Identical|Add topic}}
continuum-action-delete:
Used in the Continuum skin, as the name of a tab at the top of the page. See for example {{canonicalurl:Translating:MediaWiki|useskin=continuum}}

{{Identical|Delete}}
continuum-action-protect:
Tab at top of page, in continuum skin

{{Identical|Protect}}
continuum-action-undelete:
Tab at top of page, in continuum skin.
{{Identical|Undelete}}
continuum-action-unprotect:
Tab at top of page, in continuum skin.
{{Identical|Change protection}}
continuum-view-edit:
Tab label in the Continuum skin. See for example {{canonicalurl:Translating:MediaWiki|useskin=continuum}}
{{Identical|Edit}}
continuum-view-history:
Tab label in the Continuum skin. See for example {{canonicalurl:Translating:MediaWiki|useskin=continuum}}
{{Identical|View history}}
continuum-view-view:
Tab label in the Continuum skin (verb). See for example {{canonicalurl:Translating:MediaWiki|useskin=continuum}}.
{{Identical|Read}}
continuum-view-viewsource:
Tab label in the Continuum skin.
{{Identical|View source}}
continuum-jumptocontent: Accessibility link for jumping to the content and skipping the navigation. Visually hidden by default.
continuum-more-actions: Label in the Continuum skin's menu for the less-important or rarer actions which are not shown as tabs (like moving the page, or for sysops deleting or protecting the page), as well as (for users with a narrow viewing window in their browser) the less-important tab actions which the user's browser is unable to fit in. {{Identical|More}}
skin-theme-night-label: Label for night theme (dark/night mode). "Dark" should be translated consistently with {{msg-mw|Skin-minerva-night-mode-launch-subtitle}}.
skin-theme-os-label: Label for night theme (automatic mode which respects any operating system setting).
skin-theme-exclusion-notice: Text that informs you that the page is always in light mode. The word "light" should be consistent with {{msg-mw|Skin-theme-day-label}}.
continuum-search-loader: Text to display below search input while the search suggestion module is loading
continuum-searchsuggest-containing: Label used in the special item of the search suggestions list which gives the user an option to perform a full text search for the term. Used in the Codex typeahead search component.
continuum-intro-page: Introduction or tutorial page for the wiki. Typically either Project/Help:Introduction ([[d:Q3945]]) or Project/Help:Tutorial ([[d:Q915263]]).
continuum-toc-beginning: Shown in the table of contents: Text of link to the beginning of the article.
continuum-toc-toggle-button-label:
Used to label TOC section toggle buttons for screen readers

* $1 â€“ The name of the TOC section to show/hide
continuum-anon-user-menu-pages:
Label describing the logged out editor links in the anon user menu. Appears after clicking the three dots menu next to "Log in" at the top of the screen in Continuum  (on wikis where temporary accounts aren't enabled).

[[File:Pages for logged out editors.png|0px]]
continuum-anon-user-menu-pages-learn: Lowercase text of link that goes to Help:Introduction and helps the user learn more about editing
continuum-anon-user-menu-pages-label: Accessible version of 'continuum-anon-user-menu-pages' link text, prompts user to learn more about editing
continuum-main-menu-tooltip: Used as title attribute for main menu icon on hover.
continuum-toc-menu-tooltip: Used as title attribute for table of contents icon on hover.
continuum-toc-collapsible-button-label: Used as the label for the table of contents collapsible toggle button
continuum-site-nav-label: Accessible label for site (main menu) nav landmark
continuum-feature-custom-font-size-exclu: Notice when custom font size option is disabled.
continuum-feature-limited-width-exclusio: Notice when limited width option is disabled.
continuum-page-tools-label:
Label for the page tools pinnable dropdown
{{identical|Tools}}
continuum-page-tools-general-label:
Label for the page tools 'General' menu
{{identical|General}}
continuum-page-tools-actions-label:
Label for the page tools 'Actions' menu
{{identical|Action}}
continuum-pin-element-label: Label for toggle button in PinnableHeader to pin an element
continuum-unpin-element-label: Label for toggle button in PinnableHeader to unpin an element
continuum-prefs-talkpage: Link to the desktop improvements project talk page which is shown before the preview link in skin preferences. See T307113 for more information.
tooltip-continuum-anon-user-menu-title: Used as title attribute for user menu icon on hover for anonymous users.
continuum-page-tools-nav-label: Used as aria-label for page tools menu nav area.
empty-language-selector-body: Text of the body of the dropdown that explains to the user that the page is not supported in other languages. The dropdown opens when the less prominent language button is clicked, inside non-content pages
continuum-toc-unpinned-popup: Text to show in popup body when Table of Contents ({{msg-mw|continuum-toc-label}}) has been moved.
continuum-page-tools-unpinned-popup: Text to show in popup body when Page Tools ({{msg-mw|continuum-page-tools-label}}) has been moved.
continuum-main-menu-unpinned-popup: Text to show in popup body when Main menu ({{msg-mw|continuum-main-menu-label}}) has been moved.
continuum-appearance-unpinned-popup: Text to show in popup body when Appearance menu ({{msg-mw|continuum-appearance-label}}) has been moved.
continuum-beta-preview-label: label for beta feature preview link in beta features under special preferences
continuum-beta-preview-description: label for beta feature preview description in beta features under special preferences
continuum-night-mode-gadget-names: pipe-separated list of gadget names associated with the night mode gadget
continuum-night-mode-gadget-warning: a notice that night mode has been disabled due to a conflicting gadget, with a link to the gadgets page to disable
continuum-night-mode-issue-reporting-not: A URL to be configured on the site-level {{notranslate}}
Tooltip for reporting errors in dark mode.
continuum-night-mode-issue-reporting-lin: Label for a link to project-specific page where people can report issues with dark mode.
Notification that shows after clicking link.
continuum-night-mode-issue-reporting-pre: The prefilled title of the form used to submit dark mode errors. $1 is a link to the current page, formatted as a wikitext external link, for example "<nowiki>[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Songhai_Empire Songhai Empire]</nowiki>".
The prefilled content of the form used to submit dark mode errors
continuum-night-mode-beta-tag: A tag appearing in the Appearance menu informing users that this feature is in beta.
